thread.title: Sanchez picks up win as Blue Jays beat Rangers in wild Game 5
thread.title_full: Sanchez picks up win as Blue Jays beat Rangers in wild Game 5

author: Ian Harrison The Associated Press
title: Sanchez picks up win as Blue Jays beat Rangers in wild Game 5
text: Sanchez picks up win as Blue Jays beat Rangers in wild Game 5 By Ian Harrison Posted Oct. 14, 2015 at 5:21 PM Updated Oct 14, 2015 at 5:26 PM By Ian Harrison Posted Oct. 14, 2015 at 5:21 PM Updated Oct 14, 2015 at 5:26 PM » Social News TORONTO — The Toronto Blue Jays have clinched their first trip to the American League Championship Series since 1993, overcoming one of the most bizarre plays in playoff history by taking advantage of three Texas Rangers errors for a 6-3 victory Wednesday in the deciding Game 5 of the Division Series. Barstow graduate Aaron Sanchez played a role in the victory. The Blue Jays rookie reliever entered the game in the seventh inning and pitched 1 1-3 innings to pick up the win. He allowed one run on two hits with a walk and strikeout. The seventh turned out to be a wild inning. The teams entered the inning tied 2-2 but the game dramatically changed in the event-filled, 53-minute seventh inning. Jose Bautista hit a three-run homer to cap the a Blue Jays comeback. In the top fo the inning the Rangers took a 3-2 lead when catcher Russell Martin's throw back to the pitcher deflected off batter Shin-Soo Choo and allowed the tiebreaking run to score. The Blue Jays filed a protest after an umpire review ruled Rougned Odor was allowed to cross home plate. Toronto fans pelted the field with debris during the 18-minute delay. The Rangers started the bottom half by making three straight errors and Toronto rallied. The Blue Jays play the winner of Wednesday night's Game 5 between Houston and Kansas City. Game 1 of the ALCS is Friday night. By Ian Harrison
